intro: Limodorum abortivum var. abortivum, commonly known as the abortive lily of the valley, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant features heart-shaped, evergreen leaves and thrives in shaded, moist woodland environments. Its limited distribution and unique floral structure make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to its rarity, it is often protected and requires careful conservation efforts.
